Text:
Did Scientists Just Uncover A
"Second Metabolism"
Hidden Inside Our Colon?

Keep reading to see:

  • Why the key to sustainable weight loss doesn’t start in the stomachi…
  • How a little known "block" may be reducing the body’s ability to burn fat by up to 94.4%...ii
  • Plus, what anyone can do about all of this starting right away…to finally drop the unwanted weight.

Maggie felt like her stomach was a black box.

No matter what she ate…

What supplements she took…

What new workouts she tried…

She STILL struggled to lose weight.

In fact, in the past few years she’d been gaining weight…

And increasingly this weight was finding its way to her belly and her thighs.

It was so frustrating…

Because Maggie simply couldn’t figure out why this was happening.

At first, she thought maybe it was her hormonesiii…

But all the tests said that her hormones were in "normal range" (whatever that meant!)…

And she was scared to try hormonal therapies anyways…

Since many of those therapies came with a laundry list of side effects…

Including things like bloating, nausea, mood swings, headaches and moreiv.

She was already bloated…

Her mood was already unstable…

Her headaches had already become more frequent…

So the last thing Maggie wanted was to make any of those things worse.

But still…

She couldn’t understand why her belly was getting bigger no matter what she did.

Most recently Maggie had tried the Keto Diet, hoping that might be the answer…

But she had the same experience as countless women before her…

Some initial weight loss in the first few weeks…

Then there was the predictable plateau…

Followed by wave-after-wave of intense carb cravings…

Wildly erratic mood swings and temper-flare-ups…

And 24/7 exhaustionv.

It wasn’t long until the weight she’d initially lost on Keto…

All came rushing back…

And it left her in the same hopeless place as before she’d started.

Then there were the workouts…

She tried to exercise; she really did…

But because she never had energy anymore…

And her sleep was getting worse and worse…

Doing cardio…

Or even a Pilates class…

Was so draining for her.

Plus, even when Maggie did workout…

The results just weren’t there.

The numbers on the scale simply didn’t go down…

Some weeks, they actually ticked up…

And by the time I heard Maggie’s story…

She was ready to throw in the towel for good.

Hi, I’m Dr. Eric Wood…

And while my friend Maggie is a truly special person…

There’s nothing unique about her story.

This is something that millions of women, and men, are currently experiencingvi…

And it’s leading to a whole lot of frustration…

A ton of tears…

And too much time spent asking "what the heck is wrong?"

So if any of this is hitting home…

Then don’t go anywhere…

Because today, right on this website…

I’m going to answer that question of "what the heck is wrong" …

And as I’m about to share…

The answer to this frustrating question…

Comes from a place deep inside of our bodiesvii…

Something that may be disrupting our health from head to toe…

And making it feel impossible to lose weight.

This is something that also may affect memory, energy, sleep, immune system, hormones, and so much moreviiiixxxi…

Yet, chances are not many people have heard about this before…

So for all the people out there who have been feeling frustrated or confused…

Or it’s ever felt like nobody understands what’s really going on…

Then please know that there is reason to hope.

Because as I’m going to explain today…

The REAL cause of all of thisxii…

The stubborn fat that just won’t go away…

The mental fatiguexiii…

The poor sleepxiv…

The allergies, the headaches, the anxiety and mood swingsxvxvi…

It all comes down to one surprising thing….

And it isn’t found inside the stomach…

It’s buried deep inside the colonxvii…

Which is one of the reasons it’s been ignored by so many in the medical establishment up until now.

Keep reading to discover…

While this Second Metabolism operates at 90% efficiency when we’re young…

By the time we reach middle age…

It’s been reduced by 94%xviii...

And there are now hundreds of scientific studies being published each year…

Showing that as this "Second Metabolism" in the colon continues to shrink…

Blood sugar levels become increasingly erraticxx…

Sleep is disruptedxxi…

Hormones start zig-zagging all over the place…

And the brain becomes increasingly foggy tooxxii.

I’ll share several of those studies in just a moment…

But much more importantly…

In the next few minutes…

I’m also going to share my simple, step-by-step protocol…

For replenishing and restoring the Second Metabolism…

And doing it FAST…

So that anyone suffering from unwanted weight gain…

Can finally begin to feel…

And LOOK…

Like their old, happy selves again.

This is something that works for both women and men…

And because it’s entirely natural…

Or needing to make big changes their diet.

It’s also something I’m comfortable recommending to adults of all ages…

Because no matter if the goal is better digestion and energy…

Or to lose pounds that needed to be gone like YESTERDAY…

Restoring our Second Metabolism…

Can make a dramatic impact on our healthxxiii.

So let’s go ahead and get started…

Because right now I’m going to reveal exactly how our Second Metabolism works…

Along with how to begin stoking its fires immediately…

To finally break free from the brutal plateaus…

And start shedding even the clingiest of fat right away.

So as I mentioned, my name is
Dr. Eric Wood.

I am a practicing physician originally from Minnesota…

I’m a Licensed Naturopathic Physician who graduated from the Canadian College of Naturopathic Medicine.

I was educated at Harvard University’s Benson-Henry Institute for Mind Body Medicine…

And I’m currently a professor of Alternative Medicine and Nutrition at Everglades University and Hawthorn University respectively.

Of all the accomplishments in my career…

One of the wisest things I’ve done…

Is to start publishing my research and work online…

That way I can reach countless folks all at once…

And share the TRUTH about their unwanted weight gain, fatigue issues, and more.

Until recently my main focus had been on erratic blood sugar…

And I’m proud that the work I’ve done in that field…

Has now made an impact in the lives of thousands of Americans.

Yet as proud as I am of that work…

What I’m going to be sharing today is even more vital…

Because this Second Metabolism I’ve been hinting at…

Is almost like a "control center" for our entire body…

Something that affects so many things…

The ability to burn fat, brain, mood, hormones, energy, and so much morexxiv…

And yet too many in mainstream health continue to ignore this.

Here’s Why The Second Metabolism
Is The Key To Reaching
Weight Loss Goals

Now while everyone has heard the word "metabolism" before…

They’re often surprised when I explain that the term metabolism…

Doesn’t actually apply to any singular thing.

Instead, the word metabolism is used to describe any process that converts food into energyxxv...

Which is why when most folks talk about metabolism…

It’s probably in pretty general terms…

Because they’re describing numerous chemical reactions…

That are happening all over the body.

It’s found exclusively inside our colonxxvi…

And it has two very specific jobs.

Its first job is to turn toxins into wastexxvii…

Then get that waste out of our body…

Which is what happens when we have a bowel movement.

Is to produce something called

Now for those who have heard of butyrate before…

It’s probably in relation to supplements that are supposed to help kickstart ketosis…

As in Beta - HydroxyButyrate...

But, spoiler alert:

Those supplements don’t work…

Because swallowing butyrate capsules and expecting to lose weight isn’t how it really works.

What does work is…

Getting our colon to produce more butyrate naturally.

Because what researchers are now realizing…

Is that this process…

Is indeed one of the holy grails in human health...

Especially when it comes to our body’s ability to burn fatxxix.

So what exactly is butyrate?

Well, butyrate is what’s known as a short-chain fatty acid…

And one of our colon’s main jobs…

Is to take the nutrients we eat…

Turn them into butyrate…

And use that butyrate as energyxxx.

This is why we say our colon has a Second Metabolism…

Because as we now know…

Makes sense, right?

Yet while butyrate powers the entire colon…

That’s really just the start…

Because continuing scientific research is finding that having high butyrate levels in the colon:

Supports the healthy structure of the gut barrier and keeps toxins from leaking out of the colonxxxi...

Promotes healthy, stable blood sugarxxxii...

Controls numerous hormones in the body - including the hormones responsible for food cravingsxxxiii...

Regulates and controls a healthy gutxxxiv…

Helps promote fat burning and weight lossxxxv…

Dramatically improves quality of sleepxxxvi…

Supports regular gene expressionxxxvii…

Serves as a first line of defense against infectionsxxxviii…

Controls and modulates the immune systemxxxix...

Promotes a healthy memory and brainxl…

Has anti-aging propertiesxli…

Plus a whole lot more.

It’s actually pretty crazy how many important things Butyrate is responsible for…

Because here’s the thing:

In a major 2015 study…

An international team of scientists scoured through 189 published papers…

All focusing on the way butyrate interacts with the colon and the gut…

And what they found…

Is that while our colons produce plenty of butyrate at an early age…

By the time we reach adulthood…

It’s even worse in the elderly by the way…

But regardless of if a person is thirty or ninety…

The point remains the same:

With each passing year, the levels of butyrate inside our colon are falling…

And given all of the ways that butyrate supports our health…

These falling levels can be truly disastrous.

This is particularly true when it
comes to weight struggles...

Because as I’ve been hinting at already…

The colon’s ability to produce butyrate is a KEY factor in the ability to burn fat.

One reason why is because butyrate
controls something called PYYxliii.

PYY is a hormone that’s released from our colon…

And one of its main jobs is to tell our brain that it doesn’t need any more foodxliv.

It’s for this reason that having higher levels of PYY in our colon…

Has been linked to less hunger cravings and less overeating...

And in a major human study that was published in the New England Journal of Medicine…

When obese subjects were given a special formula designed to increase their PYY levels…

It reduced their hunger and food consumption by a staggering 30%.xlv

These findings are further supported by two major studies…

One study published in the Annals of Nutrition and Metabolism…xlvi

And the other European Journal of Applied Physiology…xlvii

Both of which were randomized, double-blind, and placebo-controlled…

And where it was found that increased PYY levels led to weight reduction…

Increased feelings of fullness…

And greater energy.

So in other words…

Having enough PYY is crucial to losing weight…

But the more butyrate levels dip…

The less PYY the colon can produce…

Which explains why many people notice that as they get older…

Their cravings get increasingly worse…

And why these days…

Even when they eat a big meal…

They still become hungry just a few short hours later.

And the thing is…

PYY is just one of the things that’s affected by falling butyrate levels.

Butyrate Impacts The
Insulin Hormone Tooxlviii

Insulin is the hormone that helps our body turn carbohydrates into sugarxlix…

And insulin also decides whether this sugar will be stored in our body as muscle…

Or as fatl.

Because our muscles only need a small amount of sugar though…

More often than not…

Insulin chooses to store sugars as fat…

And this is one of the reasons…

That when people struggle with erratic blood sugar…

They also often struggle with their weight as well.

Now perhaps many people already have heard this before…

But what most people don’t know…

Is just how much butyrate helps support normal insulin levels in the body.

When adults were given a special formula designed to increase their butyrate levels…

Their insulin sensitivity increased by nearly 10% in just 4 weeks.li

This is a big deal because the better our insulin sensitivity is…

The less insulin we need to produce…

And the less opportunities cells have to store sugar as fat.

This finding is backed up in several additional studies by the way...lii liii liv lv lvi

Now many folks might be wondering how butyrate helps support healthy insulin levels…

And honestly, it’s pretty scientific…

But the short version…

Is that butyrate can help regulate something called "gene expression" …

And this includes the genes responsible for controlling how much insulin we produce.lix lx

Producing Enough Butyrate In The Colon Also
Leads To Something Called "Fat Oxidation"lxi

Which is another fancy sounding term…

But all fat oxidation really means…

Is "the burning of fat."

Which was a randomized, double-blind, crossover study…

Overweight men were split into two groups…

With half of them getting a mixture that helped increase butyrate levels in the body…

And the other half getting a placebo.

The study only lasted for four days…

Yet at the end of the 96 hours…

Which means that even when they were just sitting around the house…

Their bodies were burning more fat….

Plus the men had increased amounts of PYY in their bloodstream too…

Which is important to note…

Since as we’ve discussed already…

PYY is a hormone that helps tell our body not to overeat.lxiii

Researchers also found that butyrate can trigger fat oxidation in multiple sites in the body…

Which is really good news…

Especially if we’re going after a total weight transformation.

This same study found that butyrate "inhibits" fat storage too…

Which means that when our butyrate levels are high enough…

Instead of staying in fat storage mode…

Our body goes into fat burning mode…

Which makes it significantly easier to achieve the target weight.lxiv

Where scientists gave half of the participants a special formula…

That was designed to help their colons produce more butyrate…

While the other half received nothing.

Both groups were then fed an unhealthy, obesity promoting diet…

And at the end of the 12 week study…

Which is simply stunning.lxv

Butyrate’s Also Increases
Our Leptinlxvi

And leptin is another one of those "fullness hormones"…

Just like PYY.

Leptin’s job is to tell our brain that we’re full and we don’t need more foodlxvii.

And in numerous studies…

Including a 2015 study published in the World Journal of Gastrointestinal Pathophysiology…

Researchers found that butyrate increases communication between Leptin and our Brain…

It also increases the speed and frequency with which we feel full after a meal…

Which can be huge when it comes to finally getting the upper hand on those powerful cravings. lxviii

Plus, it’s also worth remembering…

There Are Numerous Other Roles Butyrate
Plays In The Body Besides Weight Loss

Scientists found that Butyrate controls our immune system, is antimicrobial, and increases the production of antiviral blood cells…lxix

Researchers found that Butyrate levels can reduce joint and hand pain significantlylxx…

Several major studies have found that butyrate helps support a healthy memory…lxxii lxxiii

Researchers studied the effects of butyrate levels on sleep…

And found that higher levels increased quality of sleep by upwards of 70%.lxxiv

So Butyrate Is Clearly Vital To Our Health...
But How Do We Get Our Colons
To Make More Of It?

I love research and I could share studies about butyrate all day…

But the real question…

Is how do we get our colons to produce more of it?

Remember, between childhood and adulthood…

The amount of butyrate produced by our colon shrinks by a staggering 94%...

And given all of the ways that butyrate benefits our bodies…

Especially when it comes to regulating our weight loss hormones…

And increasing our body’s natural fat-burning abilities…

These shrinking butyrate levels…

Are a huge problem.

So how do we get our bodies to produce much more of the stuff?

That way burning fat and having energy…

Becomes easy again…

Just like when we were kids (and we had high amounts of butyrate).

Well that’s the question I sought out to answer…

I was thinking about Maggie, whose story
I shared at the start of this presentation…

And I knew that there were millions of other folks out there just like Maggie…

People who felt like their health was some impossible riddle…

Even though the truth is…

So much of it comes down to nothing more than our shrinking levels of butyrate.

Well I found that one way to get our colon to make more butyrate…

And the reason why is because as fiber passes through our colon…

It undergoes a process called fermentation…

And butyrate is created during this process.

It sounds simple…

And in theory it is…

But here’s the problem with fiber:

Less than 5% of Americans are getting the recommended daily intake of fiber...lxxv

And that’s even with all of the fiber supplements we see advertised on TV…

Along with all of the supermarket foods that are fiber-enriched.

So what’s going on here?

Well thanks to mass-production of fruits and vegetables…

Foods that used to have a high fiber content…

Are now being stripped of their nutrients, including fiberlxxvi…

And even when big companies try to add fiber back into foods…

Or sell fiber powders…

They’re often presenting an artificial option…

Something that doesn’t sit in the colon and become fermented…

But that passes rapidly through the body…

Resulting in uncomfortable trips to the bathroom.lxxvii

Worse still…

Because this artificially modified fiber passes through the body so quickly….

It doesn’t have a chance to ferment…

Which means our colon doesn’t get the chance to make more butyrate.

So is it any wonder that our butyrate levels
have been dropping so much?

We’re only born with a limited amount of butyrate…

Then our colons are continuously deprived of the opportunity to make more butyrate…

So by the time we reach adulthood…

We hardly have any left.

It’s a big problem…

And it’s one that, at first, I wasn’t sure could be fixed.

I looked at fiber powders to recommend to my patients…

But like I’ve said…

Many of them are made with poor forms of fiber that don’t actually benefit the gut all that much.

I also looked at butyrate supplements that folks sell online…

Which are often sold as "keto pills" that will help people to burn fat rapidly…

But the research just isn’t there for those pills…

Because the best way to increase butyrate levels in the body…

Isn’t to swallow some "keto salt"…

It’s to get the colon to produce more butyrate naturally…

That way it can actually do the job it’s supposed to do and:

  • Improve colon healthlxxviii…
  • Activate the body’s natural fat burning processeslxxix…
  • Regulate hormones like Insulin, PYY and Leptinlxxx…
  • Support sleeplxxxi…
  • And help people get back to feeling like their old selves.

It was so frustrating…

I knew there had to be a better way…

Something that was easy and simple…

But that was proven to get our colons producing more butyrate…

In as little amount of time possible.

I Needed To Find A Proven Solution...
Something That People Could Trust...

They are a company that’s based here in the United States, in Colorado…

Each of which has been proven in numerous studies…

To increase butyrate production in the body...

It’s Called MB-2...

Now I’m going to share each of the butyrate producing probiotics inside MB-2 in just a second…

Butyrate Producing Ingredient #1:
L. Plantarum

L. plantarum is a probiotic that’s found in fermented foods like sauerkraut, pickles, and kimchi...lxxxii

And it also happens to be like super-fertilizer for the body’s butyrate levels.

Scientists found that adding L. plantarum to the diet:

"Significantly increased" the abundance of butyrate in the colon…

While also strengthening our intestines and reducing swelling in the gut.lxxxiii

An international team of researchers found that supplementing with L. plantarum…

Not only allowed the colon to increase production of butyrate…

But it also created a new "metabolic route" for butyrate…

Which means L. plantarum made it easier for butyrate to reach key hormones in the body…

And tell them to start burning fat.lxxxiv

Because recently…

When a team of scientists at the University of Chicago started looking into L. plantarum…

They were shocked to find that just 24 hours after supplementing with this probiotic…

It was already increasing butyrate production in the colon by 250%.lxxxv

When our colon starts making more butyrate…

We start having less cravings and we start burning more fat…

And L. plantarum is proven to help our colon produce more butyrate, starting in just 24 hours.

Because in a major study published in the highly respected Nutrition Journal…

That was randomized, double-blind, and placebo controlled…

When 40 overweight adults were either given the probiotic L. plantarum…

Or a placebo.

Researchers found that while the placebo group didn’t show any major improvements…

The L. plantarum group had a significantly lower Body Mass Index…

Plus their blood sugar had become significantly less erratic too. lxxxvi

With half getting an L. plantarum supplement…

And the other half receiving a placebo…

Insulin and blood sugar levels became dramatically less erratic…

The women experienced substantial weight loss…

Plus their hearts were healthier too.

And that’s still just the start of what L. plantarum can do…

In a randomized trial of 110 women, L plantarum was shown to lead to a "significant reduction in wrinkle depth" and "skin elasticity"…lxxxvii

Numerous studies link L. plantarum to anti-aging benefits…lxxxviii lxxxix xc

And numerous studies show that L. plantarum supports healthy brain function and memory too.xci xcii

This stuff alone should have everyone jumping out of their chair, ready to shout about L. plantarum from the rooftops…

And yet L. plantarum is just one of SEVEN total butyrate-producing probiotic strains…

That’s found inside of MB-2.

Butyrate Producing Ingredient #2:
L. Rhamnosus

L. rhamnosus is one of the most popular probiotic strains out there…

Although for reasons I’ll explain in a moment…

Many supplement companies get the dosage completely wrong.

And that’s a huge shame…

Because when we do get the right amount of L. rhamnosus into our gut…

It essentially travels directly to our colon…

Turns the traffic signal from "red" to "green"…

And gets our colon’s butyrate production revving and roaringxciii.

In a 2018 study published in Scientific Reports…

A team of 12 scientists found that butyrate production was "significantly enriched"…

When humans were given a supplement containing L. rhamnosus.xciv

These findings are supported by another major study…

This one conducted by a team of 7 researchers from the University of Chicago…

Where they found that L. rhamnosus led to a "significant increase" in butyrate…

And that this increase also helped to reduce the severity of food allergies as well.xcv

Another study, this one published in the journal Immunity found more of the same…

More L. rhamnosus led to higher butyrate levels…

But what’s really cool about this particular study…

Is that they also found that the increased levels of butyrate…

Led to stronger, healthier bones too.xcvi

And check out this major study from the British Journal of Nutrition…

Where scientists took 153 overweight adults…

Gave half of them a daily supplement of L. rhamnosus

And gave the other half got a placebo.

The study was intended to go on for 24 weeks…

But after just 12 weeks…

The scientists were shocked to see that in the L. rhamnosus group…

The average weight lost was "significantly higher than in women in the placebo group"…

Plus in the 12 weeks that followed…

The women in the L. rhamonsus group continued to lose body weight and fat mass…

While the placebo group actually gained weight.

It’s pretty staggering…

This is a large-scale study with a lot of folks…

It was published in one of the most prestigious scientific journals in the world…

And yet the final conclusion reached by the researchers who conducted this study…

Was that L rhamnosus "helps obese women to achieve sustainable weight loss."xcvii

Butyrate Producing Ingredient #3:
L. Acidophilus

What’s really special about L. acidophilus…

Is that it’s been shown to actually STOP bad gut bacteria from killing butyrate in our colon.xcviii

In one major study that was published in the American Journal of Physiology…

L. acidophilus actually neutralized dangerous E. coli in the gut…

Before it could attack butyrate and do damage to the human body…xcix

And these findings are backed up by another flagship study…

Which was published in the journal Nature Reviews…

That found L. acidophilus to "open the door to butyrate"…

By destroying E. coli and other dangerous bacteria that are living in our gut.

These findings are a big deal…

Because nobody wants E. coli swimming around inside of them…

And it’s certainly not good to let it destroy our colon’s precious supply of butyrate…

Or else long-term weight loss is close to impossible to achieve.

Fortunately, when we do get the right dosage of L. acidophilus into our gut…

Weight loss can be easy…

As numerous randomized, double-blind, and placebo-controlled studies have shown.c ci

So instead…

Let me just quickly cover the four additional butyrate-producing probiotics that’s found inside MB-2…

Why MB-2 Can’t Be Found At The Store
(Or Anywhere Else On The Web)

Now it should be pretty clear why the seven butyrate-producing probiotics inside MB-2 are so special…

And the reality is…

While it’s possible to run to the nearest health food store and ask them for all 7 of these ingredients…

First, there’s all these other things to consider:

  • Which strain is the purest for each probiotic…
  • How much of each probiotic strain to take…
  • How long to keep taking the probiotics…
  • And if the particular strains are even safe for human use.

Plus, even if there was all the time in the world to spend weeks or months on research…

It’s still going to cost a fortune trying to stock up on the highest quality versions of each of these ingredients…

(Trust me, I know from personal experience!)

And on top of that…

While there are some supplements out there that combine many of these probiotic strains together…

It’s also hard to trust most random supplements found online or on supermarket shelves…

Since there’s no promise that they’ve been tested for purity, or contain bioavailable ingredients

from Nucentix the moment I saw it...

Because not only am I a medical doctor who is highly impressed by what the team at Nucentix has done…

        /*---- Main Css ------*/


        .sec1 {
            background: url(/mb-img/banner_bg.jpg) no-repeat top right;
            background-size: cover;
            padding: 70px 0px 0px;
            min-height: 756px;
        }

        .sec1_green_sec:after {
            background: url(/mb-img/curve.png) no-repeat;
            content: '';
            width: 508px;
            height: 398px;
            position: absolute;
            top: -10px;
            right: 0;
            background-size: 100%;
            z-index: 9;
        }


        .sec1_green_sec li {
            font-family: 'averta-semiboldituploadedfile';
            text-align: left;
            color: #001c29;
            /*display: flex;*/
            align-items: start;
            font-size: 22px;
            padding: 6px 0px;
            line-height: 27px;
        }

        .sec1_green_sec li img {
            /*padding-right: 14px;*/
            padding-top: 7px;
            margin-left: -4%;
        }


        .sec1_green_sec_inner {
            position: relative;
            z-index: 9;
        }

        .sec1_green_sec .col-7 {
            width: 60%;
        }

        .sec1_green_sec .green_sec_before {
            position: absolute;
            top: -7px;
            left: 0;
            width: 61%;
            height: 117%;
            background: #a2d386;
            border-left: 20px solid #6c9e50;
        }

        .sec2 {
            background: #eff3f8;
        }

        .sec2 .container {
            z-index: 9;
            position: relative;
        }

        .sec2:before {
            position: absolute;
            top: 20px;
            left: -120px;
            content: "";
            background: url(/mb-img/img2.jpg) no-repeat;
            width: 570px;
            height: 1069px;
            background-size: 100%;
        }

        .sec2:after {
            position: absolute;
            bottom: 0px;
            right: -50px;
            content: "";
            background: url(/mb-img/img3.jpg) no-repeat;
            width: 689px;
            height: 893px;
            background-size: 100%;
        }

        .img4 {
            position: absolute;
            right: -50px;
            top: 0;
            width: 550px;
        }

        .img5 {
            float: left;
            margin: 15px 20px 0 0;
        }

        .sec3 .col-8 {
            padding-right: 30px;
            width: 60%;
        }

<script src="https://sl1.getmb2.com/jquery.min.js"></script>
<script>
    $(document).ready(function () {
        $('.accordion-header').toggleClass('inactive-header');
        var contentwidth = $('.accordion-header').width();
        $('.accordion-content').css({
            'width': contentwidth
        });
        $('.accordion-header').first().toggleClass('active-header').toggleClass('inactive-header');
        $('.accordion-content').first().slideDown().toggleClass('open-content');
        $('.accordion-header').click(function () {
            if ($(this).is('.inactive-header')) {
                $('.active-header').toggleClass('active-header').toggleClass('inactive-header').next().slideToggle().toggleClass('open-content');
                $(this).toggleClass('active-header').toggleClass('inactive-header');
                $(this).next().slideToggle().toggleClass('open-content');
            } else {
                $(this).toggleClass('active-header').toggleClass('inactive-header');
                $(this).next().slideToggle().toggleClass('open-content');
            }
        });
        return false;
    });

    $(document).ready(function () {
        $('a[href^="#"]').bind('click', function (e) {
            e.preventDefault();
            var target = this.hash;
            $target = $(target);
            $('html, body').stop().animate({
                'scrollTop': $target.offset().top - 10
            }, 900, 'swing', function () {
            });
        });
    });
    window.onload = function () {

        var newd1 = new LazyLoad({
            elements_selector: ".lazy"
        });
    }
</script>

<script defer>
    var currentYear = new Date().getFullYear();
    $("#cyear").html(currentYear);

    var hash = window.location.hash;
    var query_string = window.location.search;
    var url_param = '';
    var new_url = '';
    if (hash == null) {
        url_param = query_string;
    } else if (query_string == null) {
        url_param = hash;
    } else {
        url_param = query_string + hash;
    }

    var first_char = url_param.charAt(0);
    if (first_char === '?') {
        new_url = url_param.replace('?', '&')
    }

    //  alert(url_param.charAt(0));
    // Store
    localStorage.setItem("hash_url", url_param);
    localStorage.setItem("hash_url_faq", new_url);
    $('.pro_href_1').attr('href', 'https://sl1.getmb2.com/step2.php?product_id=437' + new_url);
    $('.pro_href_3').attr('href', 'https://sl1.getmb2.com/step2.php?product_id=438' + new_url);
    $('.pro_href_6').attr('href', 'https://sl1.getmb2.com/step2.php?product_id=439' + new_url);

</script>
